feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial application: it extracts listing financial data, computes loan summaries, DTI, monthly payments, and investment rules (70% and 1% rules), and supports saving/comparing properties. The Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages show purposeful design, working features, and handling of real-world constraints, meeting the PASS threshold.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates automated scraping and rule-based investment calculations (DISCOVER/IMPLEMENT/REFLECT) but contains no mention or evidence of AI models, learning, or intelligent inference. Because AI integration is neither described nor demonstrated, the criterion is not met.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "so, just to kind of walk you through how the app works, you copy and paste the URL from the listing and it autogenerates as you can see listing price, the monthly property tax, HOA fees if any."
"Paste it in here. Enter. Let the app scrape."

"So we see the loan summary. It has our list price, the down payment, which we can change if we wanted a different uh monthly payment. So as we see with our current interest rate, this is the amount of interest we pay, our current income. This is our debt to income ratio and our estimated monthly payment."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: student states app purpose ("analyze real estate and compare"). Implement: demo of scraping, input fields, saving and comparing properties. Reflect: noted implementation limits (sites blocking scraping) and adaptation to Craigslist.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial application: it extracts listing financial data, computes loan summaries, DTI, monthly payments, and investment rules (70% and 1% rules), and supports saving/comparing properties. The Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages show purposeful design, working features, and handling of real-world constraints, meeting the PASS threshold.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "Hello, my name is Gage Pitman and today I will be walking you through this app that I created to analyze real estate and compare."
"Paste it in here. Enter. Let the app scrape."
"when I was creating the app, I ran into a lot of problems because a lot of uh real estate sites uh block scraping."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- DISCOVER: Student describes the app goal (analyze and compare real estate) showing intent to automate analysis but does not mention AI techniques.
- IMPLEMENT: Student discusses scraping and rule-based calculations (autogenerate fields, 70% rule, 1% rule), indicating engineering work but no AI components.
- REFLECT: Student reflects on scraping challenges, again focused on data acquisition rather than AI model use.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates automated scraping and rule-based investment calculations (DISCOVER/IMPLEMENT/REFLECT) but contains no mention or evidence of AI models, learning, or intelligent inference. Because AI integration is neither described nor demonstrated, the criterion is not met.
